instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115B: What is 820-3115B? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D9701: What is D9701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.BKL_PWM: What is BKL_PWM? BKL_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.BKL_EN: What is BKL_EN? BKL_EN enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Backlight, No Boost?
threads.message:
Hello!

I've got an image, chime etc..
Can't quite work out if the chip is screwed or its something else, nothing on backlight filter and i'm unsure what the <SIGNAL>BKL_ISEN</SIGNAL> is suppose to be on a normal board. Don't have one to hand.
Any help would be amazing!

This board is undamaged, No drop or water damage. Backlight was flickering randomly for a few hours, it then died completely
Diode mode test on PIN 2 <DIODE>D9701</DIODE> (Red on ground, Black on pin) = 0.597


<SIGNAL>PPBUS_SW_BKL</SIGNAL>
L9701 PIN 1 - 12.6v
L9701 PIN 2 - 12.6v

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_BKL</SIGNAL> - 5v
<CAPACITOR>C9710</CAPACITOR> PIN 1 - 5v
<CAPACITOR>C9710</CAPACITOR> PIN 2 - 0 (GND)

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_BKL_VDDIO</SIGNAL> - 3.3v
<CAPACITOR>C9711</CAPACITOR> PIN 1 - 3.3v
<CAPACITOR>C9711</CAPACITOR> PIN 2 - 0v (GND)

L9701 (INDUCTOR, NO BOOST!?)
PIN 1 - 12.5
PIN 1 - 12.5

<SIGNAL>BLK_VSYNC_R</SIGNAL> (HAVE TESTED BOTH RESISTORS, 10k EACH)
<RESISTOR>R9755</RESISTOR> PIN 1 - 0v
<RESISTOR>R9755</RESISTOR> PIN 2 - 0v

<SIGNAL>BLK_FLTR</SIGNAL>
<RESISTOR>R9741</RESISTOR> PIN 1 - 0v
<RESISTOR>R9741</RESISTOR> PIN 2 - 0v

<SIGNAL>BLK_SCL</SIGNAL>
<RESISTOR>R9753</RESISTOR> PIN 1 - 3.3v
<RESISTOR>R9753</RESISTOR> PIN 2 - 3.3v

<SIGNAL>BLK_SDA</SIGNAL>
<RESISTOR>R9757</RESISTOR> PIN 1 - 3.3v
<RESISTOR>R9757</RESISTOR> PIN 2 - 3.3v

<SIGNAL>BKL_ISET</SIGNAL>
<RESISTOR>R9714</RESISTOR> PIN 1 - 0v
<RESISTOR>R9714</RESISTOR> PIN 2 - 0v

<SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>
<RESISTOR>R9731</RESISTOR> PIN 1 - 12.5v
<RESISTOR>R9731</RESISTOR> PIN 2 - 3.1v

(DIODE AFTER INDUCTOR)
<DIODE>D9701</DIODE> PIN 1 - 12.6v
<DIODE>D9701</DIODE> PIN 2 - 12.6v

(FEEDBACK LINE)
XW9720 PIN 1 - 3.5v
XW9720 PIN 2 - 3.5v

<SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> (WORKING)
<RESISTOR>R9703</RESISTOR> PIN 1 - 3.3v
<RESISTOR>R9703</RESISTOR> PIN 2 - 3.3v

<SIGNAL>BKL_ISEN1</SIGNAL> - <RESISTOR>R9717</RESISTOR> - 0.5v / 0.5v
<SIGNAL>BKL_ISEN2</SIGNAL> - <RESISTOR>R9718</RESISTOR> - 0.27v / 0.27v (PROBE POINT 0.450v)
<SIGNAL>BKL_ISEN3</SIGNAL> - <RESISTOR>R9719</RESISTOR> - 0.16v / 0.16v (PROBE POINT 0.203v)
<SIGNAL>BKL_ISEN4</SIGNAL> - <RESISTOR>R9720</RESISTOR> - 0.16v / 0.16v (PROBE POINT 0.16v)
<SIGNAL>BKL_ISEN5</SIGNAL> - <RESISTOR>R9721</RESISTOR> - 0.16v / 0.16v
<SIGNAL>BKL_ISEN6</SIGNAL> - <RESISTOR>R9722</RESISTOR> - 0.12v / 0.11v

<SIGNAL>TP_BKL_FAULT</SIGNAL> - 0v

threads.message:
Thanks Rossman!!

I will swap and update,

Do you know what i should be expecting on the <SIGNAL>BKL_ISEN</SIGNAL> clusters??
